title: Teenager fumes after boss at posh steak restaurant rejected her for waitress job 'with crying emoji'
text:
Teenager fumes after boss at posh steak restaurant rejected her for waitress job 'with crying emoji' Megan Dixon, 18, received a text moments after her interview with Miller and Carter steakhouse which read: "It's a no"   Share   Comments By Steve Robson 01:58, 9 FEB 2017 News Megan Dixon, 18, said the text message reply was "a really bitchy thing to do" (Photo: Instagram/megrdixon)   Share   Comments Get daily   A teenager has slammed the boss of a posh steak restaurant after she was rejected for a waitressing job with a crying emoji.
Megan Dixon, 18, went for an interview at a new branch of Miller and Carter in Leicester.
She says assistant manager Shantell Wesson had told her she would receive an email in a few days telling her if she'd got the job.
But Megan says moments after leaving the restaurant she received a text which read simply: "It's a no"
When she replied asking: "Okay. How come?" she was told "Just not engaging. And answers were 'like' basic"
A crying face emjoi was also tagged onto the end of the message.
Teen turned down for waitressing job with crying emoji (Photo: Twitter) Megan hit back at the rejection claiming Ms Wesson was "unprofessional" and "unprepared" adding: "Her phone was going off throughout the interview."
She went on: "I was shocked. The least she should have given me was some proper feedback.
"It was a really bitchy thing to do."
When contacted by The Sun, Shantel Wesson refused to comment but a Miller and Carter spokeswoman said: "We canâ€™t apologise enough to Megan.
"It was never our intention to be disrespectful or upset her in any way.
"The texts were sent in error and were intended for our manager, not the candidate."
She added the incident was being taken "extremely seriously" and would be investigated.
